intro: Gagea ignota, commonly known as the unknown gagea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, round bulbs that are used for propagation. Gagea ignota typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas. It is often found in the Pacific Northwest and is adapted to mild, moist climates.
